news.title: Trump wants the U.S. shipbuilding industry to be great again. Here's what it will take, and what's at stake
news.description: President Donald Trump is promising a U.S. shipbuilding renaissance to rival China, but it will not happen overnight and will require allies.

news.title: Person of interest detained in Brown University shooting that killed 2 and wounded 9
news.description: A person of interest was in custody Sunday after a shooting during final exams at Brown University that killed two students and wounded nine others.

news.title: End of 'The Berkshire Way'? Combs' departure isn't only big change as Buffett transition nears
news.description: There were several additional personnel changes in Monday's three-page news release that signal the company is moving toward a more conventional structure.

news.title: Gunmen kill 16 at Australia's Bondi Beach Jewish holiday event
news.description: Gunmen opened fire at a Jewish holiday celebration at Sydney's Bondi Beach on Sunday, killing at least 16 people in a targeted antisemitic attack.

news.title: ServiceNow in talks to acquire cybersecurity startup Armis in potential $7 billion deal, Bloomberg reports
news.description: Software company ServiceNow is in advanced discussions to acquire Armis, a cybersecurity startup last valued at $6.1 billion.

news.title: Bank of America recommends these stocks because of their link to trends like the high-end consumer
news.description: Bank of America says stocks like Nvidia have more room to run.

news.title: Global week ahead: Europe under fire
news.description: European leaders prepare to meet after U.S. President Trump calls them "weak," at a critical time for Ukraine peace deal negotiations.

news.title: Ukraine's Zelenskyy ditches ambition to join NATO ahead of peace talks
news.description: Ukraine has relinquished its ambition of joining the NATO military alliance in exchange for Western security guarantees, President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said.

news.title: Lukashenko frees Nobel winner Bialiatski and key Belarus opposition figures in deal with the U.S.
news.description: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko freed 123 prisoners on Saturday after two days of talks with an envoy for U.S. President Donald Trump.

news.title: TSA is giving airline passenger data to ICE for deportation push: NYT
news.description: The program led to the arrest in Boston of Any Lucía López Belloza, a college student who was deported to Honduras, the report said.

news.title: Oracle says there have been 'no delays' in OpenAI arrangement after stock slide
news.description: Oracle pushed back against a report that said the company will complete data centers for OpenAI, one of its major customers, in 2028, rather than 2027.

news.title: A big week of economic data is next for a stock market in the throes of a major rotation
news.description: Any positive surprise in the jobs or inflation data next week could open the door for stock buyers just ahead of the holidays.

news.title: AI order from Trump might be ‘illegal,’ Democrats and consumer advocacy groups claim
news.description: President Donald Trump's executive order on a national artificial intelligence framework threatens funding for states that pursue AI laws deemed "onerous."

news.title: Trump sued by preservation group seeking to halt White House ballroom construction
news.description: The lawsuit argues that President Trump was legally required to get federal approvals before demolishing the historic East Wing of the White House.

news.title: 'Appetizer economy': Food inflation is on restaurant table as diners go smaller with menu choices
news.description: Spending on restaurant appetizers is booming during this period of food inflation as consumers find creative ways to cut back even as they continue to dine out.

news.title: The case for more Fed rate cuts could rest on a 'systematic overcount' of jobs numbers
news.description: There are indications that policymakers will be more inclined to cut further if the labor market stays weak.

news.title: Trump administration's new quarters feature pilgrims, ditching civil rights theme
news.description: Special quarter-dollar coin designs for the U.S.' 250th birthday feature pilgrims and former presidents rather than previously floated civil rights themes.

news.title: U.S. has to stop taking in 'below-average' immigrants who won't help economy, says Lutnick
news.description: The White House is rolling out its gold card visa.

news.title: Bessent to propose major overhaul of regulatory body created from financial crisis
news.description: In a letter set to be released Thursday, Bessent will recommend changing the approach of the Financial Stability Oversight Council.

news.title: Bessent says U.S. will finish the year with 3% GDP growth, sees 'very strong' holiday season
news.description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said the economy will end the year on strong footing and said the president was disappointed in economic coverage in the media.

news.title: Here are 4 major moments that drove the stock market last week
news.description: The S&P 500 ran into a brick wall Friday and finished the week lower, just one day after closing at a record high.

news.title: Coinbase to soon unveil prediction markets powered by Kalshi, source says
news.description: A source told CNBC that Coinbase will soon unveil prediction markets, powered by Kalshi, underscoring the firm's push to fulfill its "everything exchange" vision.

news.title: Broadcom tumbles 11% despite blockbuster earnings as 'AI angst' weighs on Oracle, Nvidia
news.description: Even with better-than-expected earnings and revenue, Broadcom slid on Friday as investors  continued to grow concerned about the AI trade.

news.title: Judge says Comey evidence was wrongfully retained, creating hurdle for new charges
news.description: Prosecutors must return evidence seized from a key figure in the dismissed criminal case against former FBI Director James Comey, a federal judge has ruled.

news.title: Two U.S. soldiers and an interpreter killed in suspected Islamic State attack in Syria
news.description: Two Army soldiers and a civilian interpreter were killed by a suspected Islamic State attacker who targeted a convoy of U.S. and Syrian forces.

news.title: U.S. Veterans Affairs agency plans as many as 35,000 health-care job cuts this month, Washington Post reports
news.description: The Department of Veterans Affairs plans to eliminate as many as 35,000 health-care positions this month, the Washington Post reported, citing an internal memo.
